title: ACIS Safety Invariants
description: Pre/post invariant checks run between FIX and CHECKPOINT in the ralph-loop. Violations trigger revert or retry.

invariants.name: Test file count must not decrease
invariants.description: Remediations must never delete test files. Test count after FIX must be >= test count before FIX.
invariants.message: Test file count decreased from {pre_value} to {post_value}. This violates the 'no test deletion' safety rule.

invariants.name: @ts-ignore count must not increase
invariants.description: Remediations must not introduce new @ts-ignore suppressions.
invariants.message: @ts-ignore count increased from {pre_value} to {post_value}. Remediations must not suppress type errors.

invariants.name: eslint-disable count must not increase
invariants.description: Remediations must not introduce new eslint-disable comments.
invariants.message: eslint-disable count increased from {pre_value} to {post_value}. Remediations should fix issues, not suppress them.

invariants.name: 'any' type usage must not increase
invariants.description: Remediations must not introduce new 'any' type annotations in TypeScript.
invariants.pre_command: grep -r ': any\b\|as any\b' --include='*.ts' --include='*.tsx' . | grep -v node_modules | grep -v '.d.ts' | wc -l | tr -d ' '
invariants.post_command: grep -r ': any\b\|as any\b' --include='*.ts' --include='*.tsx' . | grep -v node_modules | grep -v '.d.ts' | wc -l | tr -d ' '
invariants.message: 'any' type usage increased from {pre_value} to {post_value}. Use proper types instead of 'any'.

comparison_rules.post_gte_pre: Post-FIX value must be greater than or equal to pre-FIX value
comparison_rules.post_lte_pre: Post-FIX value must be less than or equal to pre-FIX value
comparison_rules.post_eq_pre: Post-FIX value must equal pre-FIX value
comparison_rules.post_gt_pre: Post-FIX value must be strictly greater than pre-FIX value

revert_and_abort.description: Revert all uncommitted changes (git checkout -- .) and abort the current iteration

warn_and_retry.description: Log the violation, warn the user, and allow one retry of the FIX step

global_settings.notes: All commands must be POSIX-compatible (no Bash 4+ features)
